page.title: 03St. George's Down
page.content: Quarrying takes place in the N.E. of the area.{Vectis Stone}extract gravel from a cap of plateau gravel over ly- ing the chalk down. Up to about 15yrs ago this was mainly used to make brick at the Rookley Brickyard: closed 1974. {Kirstie Ferris writes: The gravel is dug, washed and graded. Today it is mainly used for concreting or curb and paving stones. They have special vehicles to carry the heavy blocks to buildings. In the 1920's a light railway arrangement brought the gravel to the road. A new{Golf course}was recently made on land that has been worked. The gravel under the old course could then be dug It has now been restored to farm land, mostly cereal crops and potatoes. {My Mum}remembers more wild gorse and foxgloves when she was a girl but the views are still splendid.
